title: 32 looming questions under center: What every NFL team still needs to answer about its QB situation
content: Will Philly's coordinator swap impact Jalen Hurts? Are Patrick Mahomes and Jayden Daniels headed for big years? Could Lamar Jackson get another big payday?

title: Sources: Mavs join in denying Knicks' requests
content: The Knicks have now been denied permission to speak with Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd, Timberwolves coach Chris Finch and Rockets coach Ime Udoka, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Tiger: U.S. Open 'favors' long hitters, short irons
content: Three-time U.S. Open champion Tiger Woods says this week's major at Oakmont "favors long hitters" and the ability to control "shorter iron" shots.

title: Sources: Rangers seek to trade Kreider to Ducks
content: The Rangers and Ducks are working on a trade to send Chris Kreider to Anaheim for a prospect and a draft pick, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Deion eager to rejoin Buffs after missed camps
content: Deion Sanders posted on social media Wednesday that "everything is OKAY" after the Buffaloes coach has not attended football camps in Boulder, Colorado.

title: Switzerland routs U.S. in Gold Cup sendoff loss
content: The United States gave up four goals in the first half and looked unprepared for next year's World Cup, getting routed by Switzerland 4-0 in a friendly on Tuesday in Nashville, losing its fourth straight game for the first time since 2007.

title: WADA urges U.S. to shut down Enhanced Games
content: The global watchdog of doping in sports said Wednesday it will urge public authorities to shut down the drug-fueled Enhanced Games planned in Las Vegas next year.

title: Hard tag reignites Chisholm's feud with Garcia
content: The bad blood between the Yankees' Jazz Chisholm and the Royals' Maikel Garcia resurfaced Tuesday night when Chisholm left with a sore neck after an attempted tag from Garcia.

title: WTA to protect rankings after fertility procedures
content: Women's tennis players who choose to undergo a fertility protection procedure will be allowed to take time away from the sport and return to competitive action with a protected ranking, the WTA announced Wednesday.

title: üèÄ NBA mock draft: Debating 30 Round 1 picks
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

content: Is it Scottie Scheffler vs. the field this week? Could Oakmont produce an over-par winner? We look at five storylines to watch this week at the U.S. Open.

title: 'Hard work does pay off': At 17, Mason Howell is the youngest player in the U.S. Open field
content: Howell is a high school junior from Georgia who shot 63-63 in qualifying to get into the field. How did he get here, and what is he hoping for from the biggest week of his golfing career.

title: NFL minicamp 2025 live updates: Saquon Barkley refreshed, ready to run it back

content: College athletics is back in the rules business now that schools can directly pay players, Dan Wetzel writes.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline

title: Whose NHL draft stock rose, declined at the scouting combine?

content: Tuesday's capitulation will no doubt leave Mauricio Pochettino wondering what he has gotten himself into.

title: All you need to know one year out from the 2026 World Cup
content: It's Messi and Ronaldo's last dance, and new stars will be born. Just how far can the U.S. go? The big talking points 12 months out from the World Cup.

title: Alexis asks for forgiveness as Chile miss '26 WC
content: Chile will miss their third straight World Cup after losing 2-0 at Bol√≠via on Tuesday to remain last in South America's 10-team round-robin competition.

title: Van de Ven: 'Strange' choice to sack Postecoglou
content: Tottenham Hotspur defender Micky van de Ven has described the decision to sack manager Ange Postecoglou as "strange."

title: Tuchel: England 'frozen' in historic loss to Senegal
content: Thomas Tuchel admitted England were "frozen" in their 3-1 friendly defeat to Senegal but insisted there was no cause for panic ahead of next year's World Cup.

title: Man City bolster midfield with Reijnders signing
content: Manchester City have bolstered Pep Guardiola's midfield options with the signing of Tijjani Reijnders from AC Milan.

title: Hayes giving overworked U.S. stars summer break
content: United States coach Emma Hayes told ESPN she will call up a roster composed almost exclusively of domestic players for the team's training camp later this month to allow European-based players to rest after a long club season.

title: Sources: Wave's S√°nchez in talks for Tigres return
content: San Diego Wave winger and Mexico international Maria Sanchez is currently in "very advanced" negotiations with Liga MX Femenil's Tigres, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mexico changes LA hotels over safety concerns
content: Mexico will change hotels in Los Angeles ahead of their Gold Cup match because of safety concerns amid the protests against immigration raids, a source told ESPN.

title: Biggest surprise, head-scratcher and more from the transfer cycle
content: Which teams improved -- or hurt -- their outlook? We award winners and losers of this offseason's cycle.

title: Parenting and game plans: Inside Jenny Boucek's extraordinary basketball journey to the Pacers
content: For decades, Boucek had professional dreams and personal ones -- and believed they were mutually exclusive. Now, as a mom and the first front-of-the-bench female assistant in the NBA, she's finally living both.

title: Rankings: Janelle Salaun makes her debut
content: Janelle Salaun makes her first appearance in the fantasy women's basketball rankings while Jewell Loyd and Aliyah Boston might not be on the decline for long.

title: What to know ahead of the Canadian Grand Prix
content: What to know as Formula 1 heads to Circuit Gilles-Villeneuve in Montreal for round 10 of the 2025 season.

content: UFC men's bantamweight champion Merab Dvalishvili's submission win over Sean O'Malley was enough to pass the best fighter in MMA history, but was it enough to claim the top spot?

title: From U.S. to Suriname, one thing to know about every team
content: With the Gold Cup set to kick off on June 14, we provide the narratives, star names and trivia you need to know for every team in the 2025 tournament.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Garnacho a target for Aston Villa
content: Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho is attracting interest from Aston Villa. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Bennett overtakes McDavid as Conn Smythe fave
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: MoU signed to install doppler radar in Wayanad
content: This project to set up a radar station in north Kerala for weather monitoring was a long pending demand of the State since 2010

title: Statewide anti-drug abuse campaign by Kolkata‚Äôs top government hospital is now focusing on students
content: ‚ÄòThere is a real need for more support for students in schools and colleges when it comes to their mental and emotional health,‚Äô the campaign leader said

title: State government formulates action plan to address waste management issues in capital
content: A compressed biogas plant for treatment of biodegradable waste will be set up in partnership with BPCL. This plant will be completed within a year and a half. The capacity of the existing Rapid Convert System will be increased to 50 tonnes to enable faster processing of biowaste

title: Railways tightens Tatkal ticket norms; Aadhaar-based authentication made mandatory
content: From July 1, online Tatkal bookings via IRCTC to require Aadhaar authentication; agent access to be curtailed in first 30 minutes

title: Tamil Nadu government is planning to constitute Special Task Force to identify and deport illegal immigrants¬†
content: Detention camps may be established soon at select locations across the State to detain the illegal immigrants while the process of their deportation is initiated

title: Writers, artistes rally behind Swaraj in Nilambur
content: Purogamana Kala Sahitya Sangham (PUKASA) organised the gathering and named the event ‚ÄòCultural Kerala with Swaraj‚Äô

title: ‚Çπ146 crore allocated to offer agricultural equipment to farmers on subsidy: A.P. Social Welfare Minister
content: Ministers Dola Sree Bala Veeranjaneya Swamy and Ongole MLA Gottipati Ravi Kumar announce that the government will procure tobacco through Markfed from June 16 to support the farmers

title: Monsoon becomes active, orange alert for two districts, yellow for eight on Thursday
content: Sengulam Dam premises in Idukki record highest rainfall of 14 cm.  Active monsoon condition likely to continue for seven days

title: Bank employee robbed of ‚Çπ40 lakh in broad day light
content: The culprit pretended to be seeking the bank‚Äôs assistance to retrive gold pledged at a financial institution

title: India is poised to become economic superpower by 2047: Bandi Sanjay
content: While the UPA term is marked by rampant corruption and policy paralysis, the NDA dispensation has ushered in an era of corruption-free governance to ensure people-centric development, says the Union Minister

title: Book on plastic pellet pollution response guidelines released in Kerala
content: State Disaster Management Authority prepares the book based on an existing work considering the situation in Kerala in the context of the sinking of Liberia-flagged ship off the Alappuzha coast

title: Towline connected to ship on fire, chance for BLEVE explosion
content: As per INCOIS, the fallen containers may drift towards the coastal stretch between Kozhikode and Thrissur and parts of south Tamil Nadu to Sri Lanka in the next couple of days

title: Development works worth ‚Çπ143 crore inaugurated in Annamayya district
content: Transport Minister Mandipalli Ramprasad Reddy highlights the major achievements in the district, which includes the implementation of the¬†Jal Jeevan Mission, launch of tap water supply to every household, and the reconstruction of the Annamayya project wall

title: Bakeries, restaurants in Kozhikode found flouting FSSAI labelling norms
content: Ingredient labels missing on flavoured halwas, fried snacks and cookies; many bakery owners unaware of labelling guidelines, leaving consumers in the dark

title: New billing systems for prosumers likely to come into force from October 1
content: The KSERC describes new regulations as forward-looking and designed to accommodate the requirements of the State‚Äôs rapidly transforming renewable energy sector

title: Revenue officials can issue ‚Äòno caste, no community‚Äô certificates: Madras High Court
content: A Division Bench of Justices M.S. Ramesh and N. Senthilkumar call upon Tamil Nadu Government to issue a G.O. empowering Tahsildars to issue such certificates

title: In forest rights push, Centre sanctions over 300 FRA cells to ‚Äòfacilitate‚Äô implementation
content: Forest Rights Act implementation has been the domain of States since it became law; cells are funded by the Union but will work as State directs; officials insist they have ‚Äòno role‚Äô in deciding claims

title: T.N. couple warned for eating egg biryani at Tiruvannamalai Arunachaleswarar temple; special puja performed
content: The couple claimed to have asked the shopkeeper for plain biryani and found eggs in both the packets only after they opened

title: Ensure MSP for ‚ÄòTotapuri‚Äô mangoes: Chittoor Collector
content: Informs food processing industries to display boards indicating the MSP on their premises and issue procurement tokens to farmers in advance

title: NH development destroying Kannur wetlands, says fact-finding panel
content: The team‚Äôs report is on the second¬†phase of its study from the Taliparamba bus stand.  It accused National Highways Authority of India of failing to account for the destruction of tens of thousands of mangrove trees

title: ED has enough material against some Cong. leaders to carry out search, says Shettar
content: The response from some Congress leaders shows that the Siddaramaiah government is trying to cover up scams by its Ministers: BJP MP

title: Drop move to conduct caste census, NSS writes to Centre
content: In a letter to the President, Vice-President and the Prime Minister, NSS general secretary G. Sukumaran Nair states that caste-based census contradicts the principles of the Constitution and risks dividing people on the basis of castes and religion. He draws parallels to the British colonial era, recalling the 1931 communal Census, which aimed to separate electorates by segregating the constituencies on the basis of religion

title: Launch of ‚ÄòThalliki Vandanam‚Äô scheme in Andhra Pradesh on June 12
content: Every school-going child will receive an amount of ‚Çπ15,000 annually under the ‚ÄòSuper Six‚Äô scheme, and the amount is credited directly to bank accounts of mothers; the government will disburse ‚Çπ8,745 crore under the scheme, benefiting 67 lakh mothers

title: Apollo Cancer Centres launches robotic pancreatic surgery programme
content: The programme aims to provide less invasive treatment options, especially for those previously been considered ineligible for surgery

title: Ashada Fridays: New measures to ease darshan at temple atop Chamundi hills
content: ‚Çπ2,000 fast-track darshan ticket to be introduced this year for devotees wishing for faster temple visits; private vehicles banned on Fridays and weekends during the season, free transport for devotees in buses to the hills

title: Centre upholds Wildlife (Protection) Act; turns down Kerala‚Äôs request for relaxation
content: Kerala had requested to relax the provisions of the Act for dealing with problematic wild animals and declare wild boars as vermin

title: ‚Çπ2,014-crore worth of development works sanctioned within a year in Kurnool: Nimmala Ramanaidu
content: Government committed to early completion of ‚Çπ80,000-crore Polavaram-Banakacherla project, while 563 hectares of drip irrigation projects already completed in the district, says Minister for Water Resources

title: KCR grilled by probe panel for 50 mins; former CM hands over book with details on planning and execution of Kaleshwaram project
content: The inquiry, held at BRKR Bhavan in Hyderabad, lasted for around 50 minutes, during which KCR was questioned as a witness

title: Indian Army contingent arrives in Mongolia for Exercise Khaan Quest
content: Multinational peacekeeping drill from June 14 to 28 to focus on interoperability and readiness under U.N. mandate

title: Baghel alleges raids in Chhattisgarh followed after his call for accountability over Pahalgam terror strike
content: Former Chief Minister links central agency action to his criticism over Pahalgam attack; no official response yet

title: Congress MLA Vinay Kulkarni to surrender before court on Friday
content: The former Minister, who is accused of being involved in murder, will go to Bengaluru now in the wake of the Supreme Court cancelling his bail

title: Vedan‚Äôs song included in Calicut University syllabus
content: Rap song Bhoomi Njan Vaazhunna idam to be part of fourth-semester undergraduate Malayalam Language and Literature course

title: Power generation at full capacity in Kerala hydel power plants to avoid sudden opening of dam shutters
content: Moolamattom  power plant produced 16.942 million units on June 10,  Tuesday which is an increase from the average production of 4 to 5 million units in the last week of May

title: Addicts approaching Alcoholics Anonymous soar despite worsening drug menace
content: The Ernakulam Intergroup of AA, formed in 1990, roughly, has around 50,000 persons currently associated with it or benefited from that association

title: Governor Arlekar convenes V-Cs‚Äô meet on June 17; key higher education issues to be discussed
content: While the primary agenda includes an evaluation of anti-drug campaigns carried out on campuses, the discussions are likely to delve into various issues faced by the higher education sector

title: UDF alleges corruption behind hiring lorries for removing silt to Brahmapuram
content: The tender invited for the transportation by the engineering wing based on the Mayor‚Äôs prior approval is riddled with problems, alleges UDF councillors

title: CBI files chargesheet against eight accused in French visa fraud case
content: The accused targeted applicants from Punjab seeking Schengen visas, through a network of visa agents, and ‚Äòreceived money ranging from ‚Çπ13 lakh to ‚Çπ45 lakh from each visa applicant‚Äô, the agency said

title: Cyient Foundation and AICTE sign MoU to build innovation cluster in Visakhapatnam
content: Under the MoU, the pilot programme will focus on transforming higher education institutions in and around Visakhapatnam into vibrant hubs of innovation by fostering collaboration between academia, industry, startups, and investors

title: Siddaramaiah writes to Maharashtra Chief Minister defending decision to increase Almatti dam height
content: ‚ÄòBy this letter, Karnataka has clarified its stand not only on submergence issue but also on its right to raise Almatti dam height‚Äô

title: Two TDP activists and a constable injured as violence erupts during Jagan‚Äôs visit to Podili
content: Trouble breaks out as YSRCP cadre and leaders pelt stones and slippers on women staging a protest seeking an apology from the YSRCP chief for the alleged derogatory remarks on Amaravati women during a debate on the TV channel his family owns

title: Leopard kills calf near Punganur
content: Forest officials appeal to the locals to not shelter their livestock at night on fields that abut the forests

title: Alappuzha farmers incur crop loss of ‚Çπ33.68 lakh in two months
content: Crops on 162.27 ha destroyed between April 1 and June 9, affecting 2,270 farmers. Supplyco procures 1.07 lakh tonnes of paddy as puncha season concludes

title: Kerala University‚Äôs archaeological excavation unearths 5,300-year-old Early Harappan settlement in Gujarat
content: The site was first identified in 2022 by a team led by Abhayan G.S. and Rajesh S.V. from the Department of Archaeology, Kerala University

title: Uncertainty lingers over land rights on forest fringe settlements despite interventions
content: Proposal for formulating guidelines and action plan to redraw the boundaries of Periyar Tiger Reserve and the Thattekkadu Bird Sanctuary triggers apprehensions in the families living here

title: 5.74 million tonnes of dry cargo handled in May by AKPL
content: It is the highest-ever monthly dry cargo volume handled by any port in India, according to the company

title: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation retakes possession of unoccupied and rented out welfare scheme flats
content: 15 flats have been taken over and reallocated to families identified as landless and homeless under the State government‚Äôs project to uplift extremely poor families.

title: Jagan warns of agitation if NDA government in Andhra Pradesh fails to support tobacco farmers
content: The YSRCP president has demanded that the State government rope in Markfed to ensure a price of at least ‚Çπ280 per kg to the distressed farmers

title: Karnataka‚Äôs Shakti scheme completes two years, over 474 crore free rides for women recorded
content: According to data shared by the transport department, between June 11, 2023, and June 10, 2025, the four corporations together recorded a total of 801.54 crore passenger journeys

title: Draft Waqf Rules propose steep cut in annual contributions to State Waqf Boards
content: The draft rules, which are being circulated among the State governments and the State boards, have proposed to fix the maximum amount annually payable by the individual Waqfs to the board at ‚Çπ5,000.

title: Interpol crackdown: 20,000 malicious IPs and domains taken down globally, 32 suspects arrested
content: Law enforcement agencies from 26 countries, including India, worked to locate the servers, map physical networks, and execute targeted takedowns

title: Meghalaya murder: Sonam blames Raj, Raj blames Sonam; cops grapple with contradictory versions
content: The investigation into the honeymoon murder of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi has intensified, with prime suspect Sonam Raghuvanshi and co-accused Raj Kushwaha presenting conflicting accounts during interrogation. The Special Investigation Team (SIT) is meticulously gathering evidence from Indore and Ghazipur to reconstruct the events leading to Raja's death in Meghalaya's Sohra region.

title: 'Kohli could have been handled better': Shastri on retirement - Watch
content: Ravi Shastri expressed his sadness over Virat Kohli's sudden retirement from Test cricket, acknowledging Kohli's significant impact as a player and ambassador, especially overseas. Shastri believes Kohli's exit could have been managed more thoughtfully, suggesting better communication was needed. He reminisced about Kohli's captaincy, highlighting the team's success and Kohli's commitment to Test cricket.

title: Trump‚Äôs LA playbook: Victory in violence - 'We couldn‚Äôt script this better'
content: Donald Trump deployed troops in Los Angeles due to immigration protests. This action sparked legal challenges from California Governor Gavin Newsom. Protests spread to other cities. Trump defended the move, citing a need for order. Newsom accused Trump of abusing power. The situation provides political opportunities for both Trump and Newsom.

title: Close call: Civilian plane narrowly escapes Houthi missile intercepted mid-air - Video
content: A Houthi ballistic missile, aimed at Israeli civilians, was intercepted by Israeli air defenses, narrowly avoiding a collision with a civilian plane. The attack, claimed by the Iran-backed Houthis, triggered sirens across central Israel and the West Bank. In response, the Israeli Navy conducted its first strike on Yemen, targeting infrastructure at the Hodeida port.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There‚Äôs a new programming language. It is called‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Rapido enters food delivery: Unlikely to dent duopoly, say brokerages
content: Rapido's entry into Bengaluru's food delivery market, challenging Zomato and Swiggy with flat fees, faces skepticism from brokerages. Analysts cite operational complexities, capital intensity, and customer experience as significant hurdles. While Rapido leverages its rider base, concerns remain about delivery experience and the incumbents' established logistics and partnerships, limiting potential disruption.

title: Deloitte's new stress buster: Lego joins wellness program for employees
content: Deloitte US is now allowing employees to use their wellness subsidy on items like Lego sets and puzzles, aiming to alleviate stress and boost morale. This update to the benefits program, offering up to $1,000 annually, has been met with excitement by many, though some remain skeptical amidst challenges in the company's government consulting sector.

title: ‚ÄòEncourages conversions‚Äô: BJP slams Mamata government‚Äôs stand on OBC list
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has accused West Bengal's Mamata Banerjee government of promoting religious conversions by granting OBC status to Christian converts. BJP alleges the state's OBC list favors Muslims, increasing their representation significantly since 2010. This move, according to BJP, is a blatant appeasement tactic for vote-bank politics, disregarding a Supreme Court ruling against religion-based reservations.

title: UPSC prelims result announced for Civil Services and IFS exams: Check direct links here
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has declared the results of the Civil Services (Preliminary) Examination, 2025, held on May 25, 2025. Candidates have been shortlisted for both the Civil Services and Indian Forest Service (Main) Examinations. A submission window from June 16 to June 25 has been announced for uploading required details. Results for four candidates have been withheld. The full list and further instructions are available on the official UPSC website.

title: Jitan Manjhi on Lalu Yadav's birthday celebration: 'Sword today, AK-47 next?'
content: Union Minister Jitan Ram Manjhi criticized Lalu Prasad Yadav's birthday celebration where he cut a cake with a sword. Manjhi sarcastically commented that if Tejashwi Yadav achieves a significant position, future celebrations might involve an AK-47.

title: Steve Jobs to Tim Cook: Never to stay ‚Äòmarried‚Äô to ..., a skill he says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: 'Deal is done': Trump says China will supply rare earths; US to allow Chinese students
content: Donald Trump announced a US-China trade deal, pending his and Xi Jinping's approval. The US will impose 55% tariffs, while China will apply 10%. China will supply magnets and rare earth minerals, and Chinese students can continue studying in America.

title: ITR filing: Several changes in Form 16! Top things salaried taxpayers shouldn‚Äôt miss
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: For fiscal year 2024-25,  Form 16 will reflect changes like increased standard deduction under the new tax regime. It will also show tax deductions from other income sources. It's important to take note of the changes.

title: Exclusive: Bangladeshi player deported from India; 80-yo legend Rani Hamid 'disturbed' by events
content: Bangladeshi chess player Rani Hamid, 80, arrived in Delhi for a tournament, but her companion Ashiya Sultana was denied entry and deported due to a previous visa violation. This incident has deeply upset Hamid, impacting her performance in the competition. Despite the emotional distress, she appreciates the support from the Delhi Chess Association.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Siddaramaiah says he got invite hours before event
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah clarified that the RCB felicitation event, following which a stampede occurred, was organized by the KSCA and RCB, not the state government.

title: AUS vs SA, WTC Final: Smith surpasses Bradman, Sobers to become ...
content: In the 2025 WTC Final at Lord's, Steve Smith surpassed Sir Don Bradman and Sir Garfield Sobers to become the highest run-scorer by a visiting batter at the venue, amassing 591 runs. Smith's resilient 66 off 112 balls, featuring 10 boundaries, provided crucial stability for Australia after a top-order collapse against South Africa's potent pace attack.

title: Patch-up soon? Trump says 'don't blame' Musk for anything
content: Donald Trump has signaled a potential reconciliation with Elon Musk, stating he holds no ill will towards the billionaire despite past disagreements. Trump expressed surprise at Musk's criticism of his spending bill but acknowledged Musk's subsequent regret over his remarks. This apparent thaw follows a public dispute ignited by Musk's disapproval of Trump's proposed legislation.

title: Raja was dead, but his post went up at 2.15am ‚Äî Inside police's ‚ÄòOperation Honeymoon‚Äô
content: Meghalaya Police cracked the murder case of Indore transporter Raja Raghuvanshi, codenamed 'Operation Honeymoon,' after noticing the couple's lack of social media posts and analyzing surveillance footage. The investigation revealed Sonam Raghuvanshi's involvement, including her meeting with contract killers and providing a raincoat to one of the assailants.

title: Vanessa Bryant breaks silence on wild pregnancy rumors with a Rihanna meme
content: Vanessa Bryant addressed pregnancy rumors with a playful Instagram Story featuring Rihanna, shutting down speculation with humor and a clear message about protecting her peace. She emphasized the importance of inner character over material possessions, sharing motivational quotes and highlighting her focus on family and philanthropy. Bryant's response underscored her right to privacy amidst public scrutiny.

title: Chips and cola in hands, man holds 4 sons on tracks till train crushes them
content: While leaving home near Subhash Colony around 12.15pm, Manoj ‚Äî originally from Bihar ‚Äî told his wife Priya that he was taking the kids to a nearby park to play. Instead, he took them to the tracks and sat under Elson Chowk flyover for about an hour, waiting for the train to arrive. He bought chips and soft drinks for the kids.

title: 'My sister is guilty, will make sure she is punished': Brother disowns Sonam
content: In a surprising turn, Govind Raghuwanshi, brother of the prime suspect Sonam, visited the victim's family to offer a sincere apology and express his support for their pursuit of justice. He asserted Sonam's guilt and pledged to ensure she faces punishment for her actions. Govind distanced himself from the other accused, emphasising his commitment to justice for Raja Raghuwanshi.

title: Axiom-4 setback: Why Shubhanshu Shukla's spaceflight keeps getting delayed
content: The Axiom-4 mission, featuring Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, faces further delays due to a liquid oxygen leak detected in SpaceX's Falcon-9 rocket. This issue, stemming from a previous Starlink mission, coupled with unfavorable weather, has postponed the launch.

title: Khaby Lame deported: What TikTok star's treatment tells us about Trump's America
content: Khaby didn‚Äôt need punchlines. His comedic empire was built on the ability to mock overly complicated solutions to simple problems ‚Äî slicing through the internet‚Äôs life-hack clutter with a single shrug. But no number of well-timed glances could rescue him from the labyrinth of U.S. visa law.

title: 'I regret some of my posts': Musk blinks in fight with Trump - will US President respond?
content: Elon Musk expressed regret over some posts against Donald Trump. He said he went too far. Musk had accused Trump of being in the Epstein files. He deleted some posts, including one supporting Trump's impeachment. Trump expressed disappointment at Musk's criticism of his bill. The President said he had a great relationship with Musk.

title: 'No remorse whatsoever': Gangster Goldy Brar's cold confession on Moosewala murder
content: Goldy Brar, a Canada-based gangster, justified the killing of Sidhu Moosewala, stating the singer faced consequences for his actions. Brar revealed a long-standing feud stemming from a Kabaddi match and Moosewala's alleged support for rivals.

title: Quasi moon: China's Tianwen takes first image of celestial object; asteroid originated from Moon
content: China has released the first image from its Tianwen 2 spacecraft. The spacecraft is on a mission to collect samples from a quasi-moon. The mission launched on May 29. The spacecraft is already millions of kilometers from Earth. Tianwen 2 will approach Kamo'oalewa in July 2026. Kamo'oalewa is a small asteroid. Scientists believe it may have originated from the Moon.

title: 'Will come to haunt you': Jaishankar's terrorism warning to West
content: In Brussels, S. Jaishankar addressed the international media's narrative on Operation Sindoor, questioning Osama bin Laden's presence in Pakistan. He emphasized that terrorism, not just India-Pakistan relations, is the core issue. Jaishankar also defended India's neutral stance on the Russia-Ukraine war, advocating for peaceful resolution.

title: SBI Clerk Mains Result: Scorecards out at sbi.co.in; check your marks
content: The State Bank of India (SBI) has declared the clerk mains result 2025 for 13,735 Junior Associate vacancies. The exam, held in April, tested candidates on General Awareness, English, Quantitative Aptitude, and Reasoning. Results are available in PDF format on sbi.co.in. Candidates can check their roll numbers to confirm qualification. SBI had earlier released Ladakh results. Qualified candidates should watch for further recruitment updates and joining instructions.

title: Man strangles wife after row over phone chats with another woman; arrested
content: In Hyderabad's Saroornagar, Maria Das allegedly murdered his wife, Chinnamma, following arguments over his phone conversations with another woman. Das, a car driver, is now in police custody. The couple, originally from East Godavari, had been married for 12 years and have a son. Chinnamma had confronted Das about the other woman, leading to frequent disputes.

title: 'Why do I need RCB? I don't even drink Royal Challenge': Karnataka Deputy CM on buying IPL franchise - WATCH
content: Speculation arose about the sale of Royal Challengers Bengaluru. Diageo India denied these reports to the Bombay Stock Exchange. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar refuted claims of his involvement in purchasing the team. He clarified his association with the Karnataka Cricket Association. Lalit Modi suggested a high valuation for RCB.

title: From India to Lord's! India bowling legend plays a role in WTC Final
content: Temba Bavuma won the toss, electing to bowl first against Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, citing favorable overhead conditions. Marnus Labuschagne opened for Australia, while South Africa included Wiaan Mulder and Lungi Ngidi in their lineup.

title: Cabinet approves 2 big Indian Railways projects - Check details
content: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has approved two railway projects totaling Rs. 6,405 crore. These projects include doubling the Koderma-Barkakana track in Jharkhand and the Ballari-Chikjajur line across Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

title: 'Housefull 5': Movie opens on decent note on day 6; crosses ‚Çπ110 crore milestone
content: Housefull 5, after a strong opening weekend, is holding decently well during the weekdays. The multistarrer, mounted on a huge budget, earned ‚Çπ24 crore on its opening day and has collected ‚Çπ114.1 crore in India so far. While Monday saw a dip, the film is expected to maintain double-digit numbers throughout the week.

title: ‚ÄòDeplorable hostels, delayed scholarships‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi writes letter to PM Modi
content: Rahul Gandhi has addressed Prime Minister Modi, highlighting the dire conditions in residential hostels for marginalized students, including overcrowding, unhygienic conditions, and lack of resources. He also pointed out significant delays and reduced amounts in post-matric scholarships, using Bihar as an example of a nationwide problem, urging immediate audits and increased funding.

title: New tatkal ticket rules: Railways announce compulsory Aadhaar authentication
content: Indian Railways is set to implement new Tatkal ticket booking rules starting July 1, 2025, requiring Aadhaar authentication for users booking through IRCTC. From July 15, an additional Aadhaar-based OTP verification will be mandatory.

title: 'Muslim countries have 644 times amount of land controlled by Israel': Huckabee
content: US ambassador Mike Huckabee suggested Muslim countries should cede land for a Palestinian state, noting their vast land advantage over Israel. He views the two-state solution as merely aspirational, a stance differing from international consensus.

title: ‚ÄúSeeking attention‚Äù: Aaron Rodgers slammed over wedding reveal; called hypocrite on privacy
content: Aaron Rodgers' recent move to the Pittsburgh Steelers has been overshadowed by the revelation of his marriage to Brittani. While Rodgers confirmed the news, his public discussion of his personal life has sparked criticism from fans online. Many fans feel Rodgers is seeking attention despite his past complaints about media intrusion into his relationships, particularly his dating life.

title: Magic Johnson slams major Indiana Pacers: ‚ÄúThey can‚Äôt beat Oklahoma City playing like that‚Äù
content: Following the Indiana Pacers' Game 2 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder, Lakers legend Magic Johnson criticized their half-court-focused offense. Johnson urged Tyrese Haliburton to prioritize scoring early and ignite Indiana's transition game. Haliburton acknowledged the Thunder's defensive pressure and vowed to improve. With the series tied, the Pacers return home needing to adjust their strategy to avoid falling behind.

title: Musk loses 25% of his wealth to DOGE; calls it 'worth it'
content: Elon Musk's association with Donald Trump's administration seemingly impacted his wealth, with Tesla's stock plummeting 33% since Trump's inauguration. Despite losses, Musk remains among the wealthiest, though his political stances are under scrutiny. Recent tensions, including Musk's call for Trump's impeachment, have seemingly cooled, with both figures softening their rhetoric.

title: People pray to tree in ‚Äòmiracle‚Äô frenzy, engineers discover pipe leak below
content: A crowd in Pimpri's Premlok Park worshipped a gulmohar tree, mistaking water flowing from it as a miracle. The phenomenon, which drew garlands and offerings, was quickly debunked by PCMC officials. An underground water pipeline burst, causing the water to emerge through the tree's trunk, leading to repairs and discussions about awareness.

title: Human-size Labubu doll sold in China: Would you pay 1 million yuan for a toy?
content: A human-sized Labubu figure fetched a record 1.08 million yuan at a Beijing auction, highlighting the doll's soaring popularity. Organized by Yongle International Auction, the event saw enthusiastic bidding both online and in person. The mint-green, 4.3-foot figure, deemed unique, captivated collectors, fueled by endorsements from celebrities like Lisa of Blackpink and David Beckham.

title: Mangalsutra Helped Crack Honeymoon Murder: Senior Cop To NDTV
content: Murder accused Sonam left behind something which the Meghalaya Police found while searching the room of a homestay where the Indore couple stayed. This object gave the police investigation a big hint in which direction the case would go.

title: New T-Rex Ancestor Discovered In Drawers Of Mongolian Institute
content: Misidentified bones that languished in the drawers of a Mongolian institute for 50 years belong to a new species of tyrannosaur that rewrites the family history of the mighty T-Rex, scientists said Wednesday.

title: Greta Thunberg Was Abused By Israeli Authorities, Says French Doctor
content: The boat also had Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg onboard, and the doctor, Baptiste Andr said that the Israeli authorities mocked and deliberately deprived passengers of sleep, particularly Thunberg.

title: Tech Calls On Kaleshwaram Project Taken By Engineers, KCR told Panel: Sources
content: Former Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao, has told the PC Ghose Commission of Inquiry that while he envisioned the project and gave overall approval, all technical decisions were taken by engineers, sources said.

title: Need Both Pakistan And India, Islamabad "A Phenomenal Partner": Top US General
content: A top US General, in a statement under oath, has stressed that Washington needs to have a strong relationship with both New Delhi and Islamabad/Rawalpindi, suggesting that the equation cannot be binary in nature.

title: Body of Missing Assam Woman Found Near Riverbank In Uttarakhand, 2 Detained
content: The body of 26-year-old Rosmita Hojai, a resident of Hojai village in Assam's Dima Hasao district, was recovered on Tuesday from the banks of a river in Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district. Rosmita had been missing since June 5.

title: "Quick Peek": Solar Orbiter Spacecraft Obtains First Images Of Sun's Poles
content: The robotic Solar Orbiter spacecraft has obtained the first images ever taken of our sun's two poles as scientists seek a deeper understanding of Earth's host star, including its magnetic field, its 11-year cycle of activity and the solar wind.

title: Cabinet Reshuffle In Karnataka On Cards? What Mallikarjun Kharge Said
content: Amid speculations over a cabinet reshuffle in Karnataka, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge on Wednesday clarified that no such discussion has taken place.

title: "Authorities Keep Sleeping": High Court Slams Delhi Body Over Demolitions
content: The Delhi High Court allowed Amanatullah Khan to withdraw his petition against the demolition of Batla House but granted three days to affected people to approach the court.

title: Kerala Court Summons Priyanka Gandhi On Plea Challenging Her Election From Wayanad
content: The Kerala High Court has issued summons to AICC general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on a plea challenging her election from the Wayanad Lok Sabha seat in the bypoll held there last year.

title: Hindu Kush Himalayas At Greater Risk Of Landslides, Floods This Monsoon: Report
content: There is a high risk of flash floods, landslides and glacial lake outburst floods in the Hindu Kush Himalaya (HKH) region this monsoon season due to forecasts of above-average rainfall, experts from an intergovernmental organisation said on Wednesday

title: Honeymoon Murder Updates: Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raj Kushwaha, 3 Others Sent To 8-Day Police Custody
content: Honeymoon murder: On the night of June 7, officials found Sonam in an unconscious state at a 'dhaba' in Ghazipur, where she later surrendered to killing her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi.

title: After 1946, World Saw Highest Number Of Armed Conflicts Last Year: Study
content: The world saw the highest number of armed conflicts in almost 80 years in 2024, dethroning 2023 as a record year, a Norwegian study published Wednesday showed, highlighting the risks linked to a US disengagement.

title: Trump Says "Deal With China Done" On Rare Earths And Student Visas
content: In a Truth Social post, Trump announced that Beijing will supply United States with"full magnets and all necessary rare earth materials." In exchange for this, United States will let Chinese students study at American colleges and universities.

title: 'Raat Gayi, Baat Gayi': Sachin Pilot On Feud With Ashok Gehlot
content: In one of the biggest political rapprochements in recent memory, senior Congress leaders Sachin Pilot and Ashok Gehlot were seen together at an event to commemorate the 25th death anniversary of the former's father and ex-Union Minister Rajesh Pilot.

title: Explained: What Is Behind ChatGPT's Frequent Outages
content: ChatGPT, OpenAI's widely used AI chatbot, is currently facing a major global outage, the fifth such disruption reported this year.

title: All Seats Booked For Next 10 Days On Kashmir Train Days After Inauguration
content: It's a booking frenzy for trains to Kashmir valley. The Katra-Srinagar Vande Bharat train service is seeing an unprecedented rush.

title: 107 Hospitalised After Eating Food Served During Tamil Nadu Temple Festival
content: At least 107 people were hospitalised in Madurai after reportedly consuming food served during a temple festival at Kalvimadai village in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar district on Sunday, officials said.

title: Trump Said He 'Could' Forgive Musk In An Interview, Before X Boss Apologised
content: After Musk lambasted his flagship bill, Trump said in the podcast that he was not happy. "It's the best thing we've ever signed in this country. When he did that, I was not a happy camper."

title: Man, 35, Stabbed To Death Over Fight Between Children In Delhi: Police
content: A 35-year-old man was stabbed to death allegedly by neighbours following a scuffle between children in outer Delhi's Sultanpuri area, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Future Power Rankings: How all 68 Power 4 college football teams stack up

title: Our final college softball rankings: How do the top 25 teams stack up after the WCWS?
content: the 2025 college softball season is over, with the longhorns taking home their first national title . here is the final ESPN.com/USA Softball Collegiate top 25 ranking . the rankings are based on each team's final record .
